page.title: 10DUNDEE - TECHNOLOGY PARK
page.content: In 1983 George Younger, Secretary of State for Scotland, gave permission for a technology park to be built beside {INVERGOWRIE. This area was created an Enterprise Zone in 1984.The advantages of this are that companies are exempt from rates till 1994, although water rates must still be paid.They also have allowances on taxes and generally do not need planning permission to build, or alter, a building.The government requires fewer forms to be filled in.Companies receive grants for new machinery and buildings,creating jobs,new starts and expansions. The Scottish Development Agency acquired this land and began the difficult task of trying to attract companies from all over the world to the site. The area was good fertile land but it met all the criteria set.
